article_title: In Southeast Asia’s Markets, Worry Over Fed Is Back
article_text:
Southeast Asian currencies headed south in September, wiping out most of the year’s gains, and the flow of money into local stocks became a trickle as investors prepared for U.S. interest rates to rise.

The currencies’ swings have investors—some of them still smarting from a wave of selling that struck the region in the spring of 2013—wondering about the safety of holdings in local-currency stocks and bonds.

Whether a slide...

twitter.description: A slide by Southeast Asian currencies has asset managers wondering whether a rout in 2013 could repeat itself. But circumstance have changed since worry over tighter Fed policies hammered emerging markets then.
twitter.title: In Southeast Asia’s Markets, Worry Over Fed Is Back
